title: Sketch Plugin Manifest
description: A JSON Schema for validating Sketch plugin manifest files.

name.description: The human-readable name of the plugin.

description.description: A general description of what the plugin does.

author.description: The name of the plugin author.

authorEmail.description: The email address to contact the plugin author.

homepage.description: A website address where users can find more information about the plugin.

version.description: The version of the plugin using semantic versioning.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the plugin using reverse-domain syntax.

appcast.description: A URL to the pluginâ€™s updating JSON file.

compatibleVersion.description: The minimum version of Sketch required to run the plugin.

maxCompatibleVersion.description: The maximum version of Sketch supported by the plugin.

commands.description: An array of objects defining all commands provided by the plugin.

name.description: The name of the command used within the Plugins menu.

identifier.description: A unique identifier of the command within the plugin bundle.

shortcut.description: Provides a default keyboard shortcut for the command, e.g. cmd alt ctrl shift t

script.description: The relative path to the script implementing the command.

handler.description: Specifies the name of function to be called with the command. The function should be declared at the top level of the script, and accepts a single context parameter which contains information such as the current document and selection. If this field is omitted the plugin will default to using a handler named onRun.

run.description: The function that should be called when the command is run.

setUp.description: The function to call before the command is called.

tearDown.description: The function to call after the command has finished to run.

onDocumentChanged.description: The function to call when the [document changes](https://developer.sketch.com/plugins/document-changes).

isRoot.description: Specifies that menu items are created directly within the Plugins menu in Sketch. By default Sketch creates a submenu for the plugin. This value is not supported for submenus.

title.description: The human-readable title for the menu item.

icon.description: The path to the plugin icon.

scope.description: Specifies if the plugin can be run without an open Sketch document.

suppliesData.description: Specifies if the plugin is a data supplier.
